Australia:
A settlement was founded at Risdon on the Derwent River in Van Diemen's Land by Lt. John Bowen.
Castle Hill convict rebellion, also known as the second Battle of Vinegar Hill, occurred in New South Wales.
The Risdon settlement was moved to Sullivan's Cove (now Hobart) by Colonel David Collins.
France: Haitian Revolution: Dessalines declared the independence of Haiti. Napoleon was declared Emperor by the Senate, marking the beginning of the First French Empire and the end of the French Consulate. Napoleon crowned himself Emperor in Notre-Dame de Paris. Napoleon had Pope Pius VII in attendance to indicate approval of the Church.
Haiti:
Dessalines, in Gonaïves, declares Haiti an independent nation and becomes Governor-General
On the order of Dessalines, the 1804 Haiti Massacre eradicates the white minority of Haiti; the massacre is finally stopped the 22 April.
Dessalines proclaims himself Emperor of Haiti
Dessalines becomes Emperor Jacques I in a coronation ceremony at Cap-Français
Russia: Russo-Persian War (1804–1813): Russian forces attacked the Persian settlement of Üçkilise.
Serbia: Napoleon annexes the Bay of Kotor to the First French Empire as a part of the Illyrian provinces. The Venetian Republic collapses after almost 1000 years of existence.
